items.title: Israel kills top Hezbollah official in first attack on Beirut in months
items.description: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.

items.title: Fifty children escape after mass school abduction in Nigeria
items.description: The raid on a Christian school came amid a surge of attacks by armed groups in the African nation.

items.title: G20 summit boycotted by US closes in South Africa
items.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa says there is a "renewed commitment to multilateral co-operation".

items.title: Ukraine's Aonishiki becomes sumo champion in Japan
items.description: Aonishiki wins the November sumo tournament in Japan and becomes the first person from Ukraine to claim an elite-level sumo championship.

items.title: Seven arrested in India after police crack $800,000 bank heist
items.description: Armed men posing as bank officials robbed a van transporting cash between bank branches in Bengaluru city.
